metadata.title: CVE-2021-32554 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would followsymbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the xorgpackage apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-gtk - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-kde - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-noui - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-retrace - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
apport-valgrind - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
dh-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python3-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
python3-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm7').
